title: Iris's Pattern Recognition
statement: Iris West is analyzing crime patterns in Central City. She has a string representing daily crime codes and needs to count how many times a specific pattern appears as a substring. The pattern matching is case-sensitive.
input: The first line contains a string S representing daily crime codes (1 ≤ |S| ≤ 1000). The second line contains a string P representing the pattern to search for (1 ≤ |P| ≤ 100). Both strings contain only lowercase English letters.
output: Print the number of times pattern P appears as a substring in string S.
constraints:
1 ≤ |S| ≤ 1000
1 ≤ |P| ≤ 100
Both strings contain only lowercase English letters
